IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: West Shore Community College Foundation exists to raise funds to support College activities. The Foundation's mission is to provide the extra resources that help West Shore Community College achieve greatness, including student scholarships and support for the performing arts.
IRS990.MissionDesc: The WSCC Foundation was established in 1971 to promote, establish, maintain, & operate educational activities for West Shore Community College, its students, & the many communities the College serves. Foundation Goals: Provide financial assistance for students, support educational and cultural program development, and encourage academic & professional development.
IRS990.Desc: The Foundation distributed $8,700 to West Shore Community College for the Performing Arts Program which benefits students as well as local residents.

ProgSrvcAccomActy2Grp.Desc: The Foundation distributed $252,262 to West Shore Community College for student scholarships during the academic year.

ProgSrvcAccomActy3Grp.Desc: The Foundation distributed $10,000 to West Shore Community College Humankind Series. Humankind is WSCC's arts and culture lecture series. The series consists of lectures, presentations, workshops, art exhibitions, film series, and much more.

ProgSrvcAccomActyOtherGrp.Desc: The Foundation distributed $8,000 to support the West Shore Community College Muddy Fox Trot fun run. The run is designed to build student camaraderie and is run annually.

Form990ScheduleAPartVIGrp.ExplanationTxt: This represents the realized gain received from our investments - public traded securities.
This represents the realized gain received from our investments - public traded securities.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Endowed funds are intended to be used to support West Shore Community College, either in direct support to students through scholarships, or assisting in the enrichment of the student through the College.
Investment fees of $68,452 are included in total revenue.

RecipientTable.PurposeOfGrantTxt: During the year ended June 30, 2022, the Foundation distributed the following amounts to West Shore Community College: $8,700 in Performing Arts; $252,262 in student scholarships; $10,000 to the WSCC Humankind cultural series: and $8,000 to the annual Muddy Fox Trot fun run annual student/community event.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Foundation contributions to West Shore Community College: Scholarships $252,262; Performing arts $8,700; Humankind $10,000; Muddy Fox Trot $8,000

Form 990, Part VI Section B, Line 11b - The Form 990 is reviewed by the College's President Form 990, Part VI Section C, Line 19 - The Foundation's audited annual financial statements, Form 990, governing documents and conflict of interest policies are available upon request from the Foundation office during business hours.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, Line 11b
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The form 990 is reviewed by the College's President

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section C, Line 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The Foundation's audited annual financial statements, Form 990, governing documents and conflict of interest policies are available upon request from the Foundation Office during business hours.

TransactionsRelatedOrgGrp.MethodOfAmountDeterminationTxt: See Schedule R, Part VII, Statement 1

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The Foundation gifted the amount of $278,962 in the form of student scholarship awards to West Shore Community College.
